intro: Mamboga stipulosa, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its roots are the primary part used, containing compounds that have been traditionally used for their medicinal properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
